org.gvsig.tools.swing.impl.hexeditor.swing

Class HexEditorComponent

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JScrollPane
            • org.gvsig.tools.swing.impl.hexeditor.swing.HexEditorComponent
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.ScrollPaneConstants

    public class HexEditorComponent
extends javax.swing.JScrollPane
    A Swing hex editor component.

    The hex editor's functionality includes:

    • Cut, copy, paste, delete of 1 or more bytes
    • Undo/redo
    • Selecting a contiguous block of bytes
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • cellToOffset

        public int cellToOffset(int row,
                        int col)
        Returns the offset into the bytes being edited represented at the specified cell in the table, if any.
        Parameters:
        row - The row in the table.
        col - The column in the table.
        Returns:
        The offset into the byte array, or -1 if the cell does not represent part of the byte array (such as the tailing "ascii dump" column's cells).
        See Also:
        offsetToCell(int)

                                  int added,

        added - The number of bytes added.

      • getPadLowBytes

        public boolean getPadLowBytes()
        Returns whether bytes that can be displayed as a single char (i.e. 0 - 15) are prepended with a "0" char to make them two characters wide in the display.
        Returns:
        Whether bytes with one-character hex representations will be prepended with a "0" in the display.
        See Also:
        setPadLowBytes(boolean)

        See Also:

      • offsetToCell

        public java.awt.Point offsetToCell(int offset)
        Returns the cell representing the specified offset into the hex document.
        Parameters:
        offset - The offset into the document.
        Returns:
        The cell, in the form (row, col). If the specified offset is invalid, (-1, -1) is returned.
        See Also:
        cellToOffset(int, int)

      • replaceBytes

        public void replaceBytes(int offset,
                         int len,
                         byte[] bytes)
        Replaces a range of bytes.
        Parameters:
        offset - The offset of the range of bytes to replace.
        len - The number of bytes to replace.
        bytes - The bytes to replace the range with.
        See Also:
        removeBytes(int, int), replaceSelection(byte[])

      • replaceSelection

        public void replaceSelection(byte[] bytes)
        Replaces the currently selected bytes (if greater or equal to 1) with the specified new bytes.
        Parameters:
        bytes - The new bytes. If this is null or an empty array, calling this method simply removes the currently selected bytes.
        See Also:
        replaceBytes(int, int, byte[])

      • setAlternateColumnBG

        public void setAlternateColumnBG(boolean alternate)
        Sets whether the column color should alternate in the hex editor. This method fires a property change event of type PROPERTY_ALTERNATE_COLUMN_BG.
        Parameters:
        alternate - Whether the column color should alternate.
        See Also:
        getAlternateColumnBG(), setAlternateRowBG(boolean)

      • setPadLowBytes

        public void setPadLowBytes(boolean pad)
        Sets whether bytes that can be displayed as a single char (i.e. 0 - 15) are prepended with a "0" char to make them two characters wide in the display. This method fires a property change event of type PROPERTY_PAD_LOW_BYTES.
        Parameters:
        pad - Whether to pad such bytes in the display.
        See Also:
        getPadLowBytes()

        endOffs - The last byte to select.
